get.description: List the operations for the provider

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to use for this operation.

schema.description: A list of REST API operations supported by an Azure Resource Provider. It contains an URL link to get the next set of results.

value.description: List of operations supported by the resource provider

items.title: REST API Operation
items.description: Details of a REST API operation, returned from the Resource Provider Operations API

name.description: The name of the operation, as per Resource-Based Access Control (RBAC). Examples: "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines/write", "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines/capture/action"

isDataAction.description: Whether the operation applies to data-plane. This is "true" for data-plane operations and "false" for ARM/control-plane operations.

display.description: Localized display information for this particular operation.

provider.description: The localized friendly form of the resource provider name, e.g. "Microsoft Monitoring Insights" or "Microsoft Compute".

resource.description: The localized friendly name of the resource type related to this operation. E.g. "Virtual Machines" or "Job Schedule Collections".

operation.description: The concise, localized friendly name for the operation; suitable for dropdowns. E.g. "Create or Update Virtual Machine", "Restart Virtual Machine".

description.description: The short, localized friendly description of the operation; suitable for tool tips and detailed views.

origin.description: The intended executor of the operation; as in Resource Based Access Control (RBAC) and audit logs UX. Default value is "user,system"

actionType.description: Enum. Indicates the action type. "Internal" refers to actions that are for internal only APIs.

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of operation list results (if there are any).

get.description: Lists all Agents in a Storage Mover.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to use for this operation.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The ID of the target subscription.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group. The name is case insensitive.

parameters.name: storageMoverName
parameters.description: The name of the Storage Mover resource.

value.description: The Agent items on this page

items.description: The Agent resource.

id.description: Fully qualified resource ID for the resource. Ex - /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/{resourceProviderNamespace}/{resourceType}/{resourceName}

type.description: The type of the resource. E.g. "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines" or "Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts"

systemData.description: Azure Resource Manager metadata containing createdBy and modifiedBy information.

createdBy.description: The identity that created the resource.

createdByType.description: The type of identity that created the resource.

lastModifiedBy.description: The identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedByType.description: The type of identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedAt.description: The timestamp of resource last modification (UTC)

arcResourceId.description: The fully qualified resource ID of the Hybrid Compute resource for the Agent.

arcVmUuid.description: The VM UUID of the Hybrid Compute resource for the Agent.

lastStatusUpdate.description: The last updated time of the Agent status.

localIPAddress.description: Local IP address reported by the Agent.

memoryInMB.description: Available memory reported by the Agent, in MB.

numberOfCores.description: Available compute cores reported by the Agent.

uptimeInSeconds.description: Uptime of the Agent in seconds.

timeZone.description: The agent's local time zone represented in Windows format.

uploadLimitSchedule.description: The WAN-link upload limit schedule that applies to any Job Run the agent executes. Data plane operations (migrating files) are affected. Control plane operations ensure seamless migration functionality and are not limited by this schedule. The schedule is interpreted with the agent's local time.

weeklyRecurrences.description: The set of weekly repeating recurrences of the WAN-link upload limit schedule.

items.description: The weekly recurrence of the WAN-link upload limit schedule. The start time must be earlier in the day than the end time. The recurrence must not span across multiple days.

startTime.description: The start time of the schedule recurrence. Full hour and 30-minute intervals are supported.

hour.description: The hour element of the time. Allowed values range from 0 (start of the selected day) to 24 (end of the selected day). Hour value 24 cannot be combined with any other minute value but 0.

minute.description: The minute element of the time. Allowed values are 0 and 30. If not specified, its value defaults to 0.

endTime.description: The end time of the schedule recurrence. Full hour and 30-minute intervals are supported.

hour.description: The hour element of the time. Allowed values range from 0 (start of the selected day) to 24 (end of the selected day). Hour value 24 cannot be combined with any other minute value but 0.

minute.description: The minute element of the time. Allowed values are 0 and 30. If not specified, its value defaults to 0.

days.description: The set of days of week for the schedule recurrence. A day must not be specified more than once in a recurrence.

items.description: The day of week.

limitInMbps.description: The WAN-link upload bandwidth (maximum data transfer rate) in megabits per second. Value of 0 indicates no throughput is allowed and any running migration job is effectively paused for the duration of this recurrence. Only data plane operations are governed by this limit. Control plane operations ensure seamless functionality. The agent may exceed this limit with control messages, if necessary.

message.description: Expanded description of reported error code

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of this resource.

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

lastStatusUpdate.description: The last updated time of the Agent status.

localIPAddress.description: Local IP address reported by the Agent.

memoryInMB.description: Available memory reported by the Agent, in MB.

numberOfCores.description: Available compute cores reported by the Agent.

uptimeInSeconds.description: Uptime of the Agent in seconds.

timeZone.description: The agent's local time zone represented in Windows format.

uploadLimitSchedule.description: The WAN-link upload limit schedule that applies to any Job Run the agent executes. Data plane operations (migrating files) are affected. Control plane operations ensure seamless migration functionality and are not limited by this schedule. The schedule is interpreted with the agent's local time.

weeklyRecurrences.description: The set of weekly repeating recurrences of the WAN-link upload limit schedule.

items.description: The weekly recurrence of the WAN-link upload limit schedule. The start time must be earlier in the day than the end time. The recurrence must not span across multiple days.

startTime.description: The start time of the schedule recurrence. Full hour and 30-minute intervals are supported.

hour.description: The hour element of the time. Allowed values range from 0 (start of the selected day) to 24 (end of the selected day). Hour value 24 cannot be combined with any other minute value but 0.

minute.description: The minute element of the time. Allowed values are 0 and 30. If not specified, its value defaults to 0.

endTime.description: The end time of the schedule recurrence. Full hour and 30-minute intervals are supported.

hour.description: The hour element of the time. Allowed values range from 0 (start of the selected day) to 24 (end of the selected day). Hour value 24 cannot be combined with any other minute value but 0.

minute.description: The minute element of the time. Allowed values are 0 and 30. If not specified, its value defaults to 0.

days.description: The set of days of week for the schedule recurrence. A day must not be specified more than once in a recurrence.

items.description: The day of week.

limitInMbps.description: The WAN-link upload bandwidth (maximum data transfer rate) in megabits per second. Value of 0 indicates no throughput is allowed and any running migration job is effectively paused for the duration of this recurrence. Only data plane operations are governed by this limit. Control plane operations ensure seamless functionality. The agent may exceed this limit with control messages, if necessary.

weeklyRecurrences.description: The set of weekly repeating recurrences of the WAN-link upload limit schedule.

items.description: The weekly recurrence of the WAN-link upload limit schedule. The start time must be earlier in the day than the end time. The recurrence must not span across multiple days.

startTime.description: The start time of the schedule recurrence. Full hour and 30-minute intervals are supported.

hour.description: The hour element of the time. Allowed values range from 0 (start of the selected day) to 24 (end of the selected day). Hour value 24 cannot be combined with any other minute value but 0.

minute.description: The minute element of the time. Allowed values are 0 and 30. If not specified, its value defaults to 0.

endTime.description: The end time of the schedule recurrence. Full hour and 30-minute intervals are supported.

hour.description: The hour element of the time. Allowed values range from 0 (start of the selected day) to 24 (end of the selected day). Hour value 24 cannot be combined with any other minute value but 0.

minute.description: The minute element of the time. Allowed values are 0 and 30. If not specified, its value defaults to 0.

days.description: The set of days of week for the schedule recurrence. A day must not be specified more than once in a recurrence.

items.description: The day of week.

limitInMbps.description: The WAN-link upload bandwidth (maximum data transfer rate) in megabits per second. Value of 0 indicates no throughput is allowed and any running migration job is effectively paused for the duration of this recurrence. Only data plane operations are governed by this limit. Control plane operations ensure seamless functionality. The agent may exceed this limit with control messages, if necessary.
